Package org.palladiosimulator.analyzer.slingshot.simulation.events

Class AbstractEvent

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.palladiosimulator.analyzer.slingshot.simulation.events.AbstractEvent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DESEvent
    public abstract class AbstractEvent
extends java.lang.Object
implements DESEvent
    Instead of directly implementing DESEvent, this abstract class already gives a general implementation for such events. This holds an ID, delay and time as fields that can be retrieved from the methods getId(), getDelay() and #getTime() that were defined in the DESEvent interface.

    This class also provides a {@linkÂ #equals()} and hashCode() implementation that follow the following rule: Two AbstractEvent instances are considered equal iff the corresponding getId() are equal. It is therefore very important to define a unique and appropriate ID, especially as this ID will be used for building the event graph. For this reason, when extending this class, use the AbstractEvent(Class, double) or #AbstractEvent(Class) constructor and provide the subclass' class literal as the parameter, i.e. 

     
 public MyEvent extends AbstractEvent {
     public MyEvent(final double delay) {
         super(MyEvent.class, delay);
     }
 }
    The convention for an ID is therefore the name of the event itself. This means that each event should have its own corresponding class extending this class.
    Author:
    Julijan Katic

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor Description
      protected AbstractEvent()
      Instantiates the class with default values.
      protected AbstractEvent​(double delay)
      Instantiates this event with a random UUID as the id, and the sets the delay.
      protected AbstractEvent​(java.lang.Class<? extends AbstractEvent> subClazz, double delay)
      Instantiates this event, where the id will be the simple name of the subclass extending this class.
      protected AbstractEvent​(java.lang.String id, double delay)
      Instantiates this event where the ID can be provided freely.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractEvent

        protected AbstractEvent()
        Instantiates the class with default values. The id will be set to a random UUID (UUID.randomUUID()) and the delay will be set to 0.

      • AbstractEvent

        protected AbstractEvent​(double delay)
        Instantiates this event with a random UUID as the id, and the sets the delay.
        Parameters:
        delay - The delay of this event.

      • AbstractEvent

        protected AbstractEvent​(java.lang.Class<? extends AbstractEvent> subClazz,
                        double delay)
        Instantiates this event, where the id will be the simple name of the subclass extending this class.
        Parameters:
        subClazz - The subclass' class literal that extends this abstract class.
        delay - The delay for this event.

      • AbstractEvent

        protected AbstractEvent​(java.lang.String id,
                        double delay)
        Instantiates this event where the ID can be provided freely.
        Parameters:
        id - The id for this event. Must not be null nor blank.
        delay - The delay of this event.
